question: Which of the following best defines isobars?
option1: Elements with same atomic number but different mass number
option2: Elements with different atomic number but same mass number
option3: Elements with different atomic number and different mass number
option4: Elements with same atomic number and same mass number
answer: Elements with different atomic number but same mass number
explanation: Isobars are atoms of different chemical elements that have the same number of nucleons. Correspondingly, isobars differ in atomic number but have the same mass number.
